column1: https://www.joebucsfan.com/2025/03/keep-your-confidence/|“Keep Your Confidence”|Joe has to draw the line somewhere when it comes to how a team spins the performance of a player. For 2024 rookie edge rusher Chris Braswell
column2: there has been a lot of talk about how he significantly upped his game late last season and that he’s poised to have a strong 2025. There’s so much faith in Braswell that Buccaneers Ring of Honor general manager Jason Licht even said he believes Braswell will “shock” fans next season. Joe can’t make the leap that Licht and Todd Bowles have. Braswell was active but did not take defensive snaps against the Commanders in the playoffs. In fact
column3: his playing time waned late last season. Braswell logged just 26 snaps through the final four games of the regular season. His first sack and only full sack came in Week 16 against the Panthers. Does that sound like an ascending player? Not in Joe’s book
column4: especially given Bucs sacks king Shaq Barrett was signed in late December in hopes he could give the edge rush a jolt. Still
column5: Braswell is 23 years old with plenty of potential. Braswell’s new position coach
column7: said yesterday he’s counseling Braswell to keep his chin up. “‘Keep your confidence.’ … Come back focused. Come back confident.'” Foote acknowledged Braswell didn’t achieve what was expected from the second-round draft pick. “‘Don’t let
column9: the lack of production — your expectations didn’t get met — but you can come back next year and you can achieve all those goals
column10: '” Foote said he told Braswell. Per Foote
column11: performance of a Year 3 edge rusher reveals what the team really has in the player. But Joe can’t buy that 100 percent
column12: and it certainly was an interesting take considering the Bucs banked on Joe Tryon-Shoyinka in his Year 4 (after a shaky third season). Regardless
column13: Joe is rooting for Braswell. What a bonus it would be if he makes a healthy handful of plays next season.|2025-03-15 12:36:00|327|53|5|Chris Braswell|Inconsistencies in perceptions of player's potential.|4|Mix of concerns and optimism about Braswell's performance

column256: ""post"": ""Twenty five rookies have had 10.5 or more sacks in their rookie NFL season since 1982. Santana Dotson got 10 and DROY for the Bucs in 1992 as a fifth round selection but this regime hasn\u2019t shown they can scout or develop sack artists or even get lucky with a one year wonder like Dotson.  I\u2019m rooting for Braswell but I didn\u2019t like the pick and don\u2019t see him reaching even JTS levels of useful/lessness let alone breaking out after getting used to the speed of the NFL game.  The Rams got a ready to roll week one source of havoc in Jared Verse but he only had 4.5 sacks as DROY but between the Rams first and second round picks they got a total of 13 rookie sacks once you add Braden Fiske\u2019s 8.5. There is no Von Miller or Micah Parsons in this draft but if the Bucs can pair Ezreiuaku with one of the many stud DTs projected to go early or ideally J J Pegues in the third and Yahya Black in the fifth they could chip their way to getting double digit sacks out of rookies and a few more out of Hall

Yahya with an \u2018h\u2019 Black from Iowa is not quite as a big or athletic as Vea but he is an undeniably fast and explosive absolute unit of 1 tech who could be a late round steal that robs opponents\u2019 guards of the opportunity to catch their breath when Vea goes off the field. Pegues and Black combined are close to 700 lbs of hyper athletic DT that can be added with the Bucs\u2019 later round picks.  I hope the Bucs land at least one of them. column1: https://www.joebucsfan.com/2025/03/larry-foote-discusses-bucs-plans-for-haason-reddick/|Larry Foote Discusses Bucs Plans For Haason Reddick|So when Haason Reddick and the Bucs came to a contract agreement
column2: Reddick wanted to know what the Bucs wanted from him and how he would be used. That’s only fair. So Reddick spoke with Todd Bowles and outside linebackers coach Larry Foote
column3: who was Reddick’s position coach in Arizona. How would Bowles and Foote use him? Reddick wanted to know. Yesterday
column4: Foote attended Reddick’s press conference and Joe asked him about that conversation. Foote chuckled about the entire conversation. “Oh
column5: that’s real easy: Be a pass rusher
column6: ” Foote laughed. “I was laughing when he started asking me those types of questions. And I said
column8: what do you want to do?'” Reddick told Foote he wanted to get after the quarterback. “That’s what we’re going to do
column9: ” Foote told Reddick. Foote said Reddick’s responsibilities wouldn’t be complicated. “That’s an easy position [edge rusher]
column10: ” Foote told Reddick. “We want you to get after the quarterback.” Bowles will move Reddick around to drill quarterbacks. “And you know Bowles
column12: ” Foote said. “We will move you all around. And [Reddick] has that ability. That’s what he brings. “He’s not just a standard defensive end. We can move him all over the place and try to feature him.” It almost sounds like Bowles and Foote will use Reddick like Cowboys use Micah Parsons. The beauty of Parsons is that offenses don’t know from play to play where he will come from. If Reddick can attack from multiple positions
column13: it’s almost delicious to think of how Bowles may use him. Just so long as Bowles doesn’t have Reddick covering Drake London.|2025-03-15 11:00:00|269|28|9|Haason Reddick|Reddick joins Bucs as versatile pass rusher under Bowles and Foote.|6|Comments have mixed sentiments ranging from optimism to slight skepticism.|"{""commenter0"": {""username"": ""Lt. column1: https://www.joebucsfan.com/2025/03/chris-godwin-fans-drive-him-to-keep-no-14/|Chris Godwin: Fans Drive Me To Keep No. 14|So one-time Pro Bowl receiver Chris Godwin entered the NFL addicted to greatness and his beloved No. 12. That was Godwin’s number at Penn State and a number he talked about being important to him. “CG12” was part of his identity. Then along came Tom Brady
column2: the greatest No. 12 in NFL history. Godwin handed over his number and switched to No. 14. In typical Godwin fashion
column3: it seemed to be a move all about respect. There was never any mention about Brady buying the number from Godwin. And yes
column4: both were asked about it at the time. Fast forward to this week and WDAE host Tom Krasniqi asked Godwin about whether he would switch back to No. 12. Godwin said it isn’t happening. Why? Because too many fans have purchased No. 14 jerseys
column6: and Godwin doesn’t want to disappoint them and disrespect their support. column1: https://www.joebucsfan.com/2025/03/larry-foote-thinks-he-knows-why-lavonte-david-returned/|Larry Foote Thinks He Knows Why Lavonte David Returned|Bucs fans were sweating right down to the last moment when Bucs icon Lavonte David decided to return for the 2025 season. So what were Bucs coaches thinking? Yesterday when the Bucs made newly-signed edge rusher Haason Reddick available to media
column2: outside linebackers coach Larry Foote was hanging around. Foote took time to chat with a few in the local pen and mic club. Joe asked Foote how concerned he was that David might retire and what the vibe was with the rest of the Bucs coaches regarding David. Foote said in recent seasons David was playing very coy with coaches
column3: including this offseason. “The last three years he had a poker face
column4: ” Foote said. “I’d try to squeeze it out of him and he’d be laughing. He’d say
column5: ‘I will let you know.’ “The last three years I had no idea. But I kind of had [a hunch this winter].” So what was Foote’s hunch? He knew David was getting close to a standard set by Bucs Hall of Fame linebacker Derrick Brooks. Foote thought the mark was regular-season games played. Foote believed David could break that this year. Well
column6: Joe looked it up. Brooks played 224 games for the Bucs. David has 198. So David would have to play through the 2026 season to snap Brooks’ record for games played by a Bucs linebacker. Rondé Barber holds the franchise record with 241 regular season games played. For David to break that
column7: he’d have to play 44 more games. That would mean David would have to play in 2027 — and hope he doesn’t miss games due to an injury. David playing through 2027 without missing games due to injury seems a bridge too far for Joe. Apparently
column9: David would consider it a high honor to be mentioned in the same sentence as Brooks
column10: or to have a franchise mark better than Brooks. “When I knew that
column13: yeah. He’s coming back.'” Joe remembers last year when Foote thought David was gone. Foote congratulated David on Instagram for a fantastic career
column14: wishing David success in his after-football goal of starting a ministry. Instead
column15: David had an ace up his sleeve on Foote and returned.|2025-03-15 08:00:00|369|25|7|Lavonte David|Lavonte David considered breaking franchise records for career games played.|2|Mixed sentiments with mentions of respect for Lavonte David but concerns about team weaknesses.|"{""commenter0"": {""username"": ""KABucs""
column17: and hoping he plays at the same impressive level\u2026 praying for no injuries. He\u2019s been incredibly durable

column19: one with the same injury Godwin had.""

column1: https://www.joebucsfan.com/2025/03/can-the-drought-be-snapped/|Can The Drought Be Snapped?|Joe didn’t know the drought was this short. Seemed like it began a decade ago. Who knew that when Bucs sacks king Shaq Barrett racked up 10 sacks in 2021 as the Bucs tried to run it back for a second-straight Super Bowl-winning season
column2: the Bucs would stop having a guy who had double-digit sacks. But that’s what happened. It seemed like the Bucs were ready to have a guy grab the baton from Shaq and be the team’s sack artist. But Joe Tryon-Shoyinka
column4: never panned out. He signed with Cleveland this week. Mike Jones of The Athletic seems to be a big believer that newly signed edge rusher Haason Reddick should snap that ugly streak. Or at least come close. Jones gave the Bucs a “B” for signing Reddick
column5: and Jones seems to blame Reddick for his 2024 holdout and never gelling with the Jets. Jones has the Reddick signing as the 25th-best signing this past week. Joe’s goal for Reddick is 10 sacks; that’s all there is to it. If he could get 12
column7: eight would be an upgrade. If Reddick has 12
column8: that tells Joe others on the Bucs’ front line of the pass rush are getting after quarterbacks
column10: teams will start shading coverage to try to slow him down. And that means less manpower devoted to blocking Vita Vea
